DataElement.preferredName: Patient Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire How Important Knowing About Cancer Prognosis 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how important is it for them to know about the likely outcome of their cancer over time, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire Importance of Knowing About Cancer Prognosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care._A question about a person's importance in knowing the prognosis of the patient's cancer.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Patient Version Prognosis Treatment and Perceptions Questionnaire
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.:A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.
A 13-item questionnaire used to assess information preferences, perceptions of prognosis and goal of therapy, and communication about end-of-life care.

Property.preferredName: Importance of Knowing About Cancer Prognosis
Property.preferredDefinition: A question about a person's importance in knowing the prognosis of the patient's cancer.

Concepts.longName: Importance of Knowing About Cancer Prognosis
Concepts.definition: A question about a person's importance in knowing the prognosis of the patient's cancer.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: PTPQ:Prognosis and Treatment Perceptions Questionnaire as referenced in Associations Among Prognostic Understanding, Quality of Life, El-Jawahri A, et.al., 2014
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for Alliance study in Rave per request by K.Allen-Ziegler. mc 5/28/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard with five text responses from extremely important to not at all important.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of non-agreement regarding the importance of something.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of non-agreement regarding the importance of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of very mild agreement regarding the importance of something.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of very mild agreement regarding the importance of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of mild agreement regarding the importance of something.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of mild agreement regarding the importance of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of very strong agreement regarding the importance of something.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of very strong agreement regarding the importance of something.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of extreme agreement regarding the importance of something.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of extreme agreement regarding the importance of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How important is it for you t
ReferenceDocuments.description: How important is it for you to know about the likely outcome of your cancer over time (i.e. your prognosis)?
